did.abstract: The collection consists of papers pertaining to a survey commissioned for Ohrbach's department store of New York City. Documents include preliminary planning maps, subway and bus use studies, location map of retail stores, zoning requirements, a photograph of the corner of Sands St., and alteration costs for an undisclosed building on Fulton Street. This survey was performed by Vincent Bordini of 264 Wyckoff Avenue, secretary of the Brooklyn Real Estate Board at 44 Court Street. Architectural drawings were completed by M.A. Jones of 189 Montague Street.
